questions.question: Fill in the blank: My mother was very ____________ when she kept asking me about how my first day of school was.

choices.answer: Persistent
Immense
Notable
Attribute

questions.question: Fill in the blank: I looked out over the ________________ ocean and felt a sense of fear.

choices.answer: Attribute
Notable
Immense
Persistent

questions.question: Fill in the blank: One of the most ________________ aspects of the of the dog was his huge, floppy ears.

choices.answer: Notable
Persistent
Attribute
Immense

questions.question: Fill in the blank: We often ______________ the bald eagle to freedom and prosperity.

choices.answer: Immense
Notable
Persistent
Attribute

questions.question: In "The Medicine Bag" how does Grandpa explain the medicine bag is passed down from generation to generation.

choices.answer: Only through chiefs
Only through males
Only through females
Only through firstborn children

questions.question: In "The Medicine Bag," why is the pouch referred to as a medicine bag?

choices.answer: It holds rocks that carry magical energy
It holds leaves that overcome sickness
It holds items that protect and guide the wearer
It holds powers needed in the work of a Lokata shaman.

questions.question: Before Grandpa comes to visit, how does the narrator feel about talking to his friends about his Lakota grandfather?

choices.answer: He makes fun of how Grandpa dresses and where he lives to amuse his friends
He becomes angry when the other children make fun of Grandpa's heritage
He likes the fact that his stories about Grandpa appeal to the other kids
He never reveals to his friends that Grandpa is Lakota.

questions.question: Which topic do BOTH the “The Medicine Bag” and the video “Apache Girl’s Rite of Passage” present?

choices.answer: Rites of passage from the Lakota culture
A boy's growing respect for his heritage and traditions
Traditions from American Indian Culture
A girl's transition from childhood to adulthood

questions.question: In "You Are the Electric Boogaloo," what advice does the author give his teen self?

choices.answer: Keep dancing, for it is making you a creative & interesting person
Learn from your mistakes and then make needed changes going forward
Dance for another year and then switch to a more respectable career path
Make good friends, for in the future they may help you get discovered

questions.question: In "Just Be Yourself!" what does the author encourage her teen self to do?

choices.answer: Get to know herself over time
Find one hobby and stick with it
Join more social groups at school
Trust others to make good choices

questions.question: In "Hanging Fire" the lines "and momma's in the bedroom/with the door closed" is repeated. What does this repetition do?

choices.answer: It furthers the plot of the poem
It hides the poet's powerful feelings
It creates a vivid and constant impression
It emphasizes the mother as a strong character

questions.question: What is the best way to describe the speaker in the poem "Hanging Fire"?

choices.answer: Hopeful
Determined
Lonely and Overwhelmed
Enthusiastic and Outspoken

questions.question: "I am fourteen / and my skin has betrayed me." What does the choice of the word "betrayed" tell you about the speaker?

choices.answer: She does not trust people
She feels that life wants to trouble her
She cannot understand why she has problems
She wishes that she were something other than human
